content:
RuntimeTransactionHandle Class

In this Article

Provides access to the run-time transaction in a workflow instance.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract]
public sealed class RuntimeTransactionHandle : System.Activities.Handle, System.Activities.IExecutionProperty, System.Activities.IPropertyRegistrationCallback

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Activities.Handle
  • RuntimeTransactionHandle

Constructors

  • RuntimeTransactionHandle()

    Initializes a new instance of the RuntimeTransactionHandle class.

    public RuntimeTransactionHandle ();
  • RuntimeTransactionHandle(Transaction)

    Initializes a new instance of the RuntimeTransactionHandle class using the specified root transaction.

    public RuntimeTransactionHandle (System.Transactions.Transaction rootTransaction);

    Parameters

    • rootTransaction
      Transaction

      The root transaction.

Properties

  • AbortInstanceOnTransactionFailure

    Gets or sets whether the workflow instance should be aborted if the transaction fails.

    public bool AbortInstanceOnTransactionFailure { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the workflow instance should be aborted if the transaction fails; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    If AbortInstanceOnTransactionFailure is false, transaction failure results in the exception that causes the failure to be propagated as normal. The default value for AbortInstanceOnTransactionFailure is true.

  • SuppressTransaction

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this run-time transaction is suppressed.

    public bool SuppressTransaction { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the run-time transaction is suppressed; otherwise, false.

Methods

  • OnInitialize(HandleInitializationContext)

    Parameters

    • context
      HandleInitializationContext

      To be added.

  • OnUninitialize(HandleInitializationContext)
    protected override void OnUninitialize (System.Activities.HandleInitializationContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      HandleInitializationContext

      To be added.

  • RequestTransactionContext(NativeActivityContext,Action<NativeActivityTransactionContext,Object>,Object)

    Initiates the creation of a NativeActivityTransactionContext for use with a new transaction.

    public void RequestTransactionContext (System.Activities.NativeActivityContext context, Action<System.Activities.NativeActivityTransactionContext,object> callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • context
      NativeActivityContext

      The current execution environment.

    • callback
      Action<NativeActivityTransactionContext,Object>

      The method to be called when the NativeActivityTransactionContext is created.

    • state
      Object

      An optional user-provided state that contains information about the request.

    Remarks

    This method is used when the activity creates a new transaction for use by the runtime. The workflow could potentially persist one or more times before the callback is called. This method allows transaction scopes in multiple branches of a parallel to queue up simultaneous requests without blocking each other from persisting at the completion of the transaction. To avoid errors if the workflow persists, make sure the state object can be serialized.

  • RequireTransactionContext(NativeActivityContext,Action<NativeActivityTransactionContext,Object>,Object)

    Initiates the creation of a NativeActivityTransactionContext for use with an existing transaction.

    public void RequireTransactionContext (System.Activities.NativeActivityContext context, Action<System.Activities.NativeActivityTransactionContext,object> callback, object state);

    Parameters

    • context
      NativeActivityContext

      The current execution environment.

    • callback
      Action<NativeActivityTransactionContext,Object>

      The method to be called when the NativeActivityTransactionContext is created.

    • state
      Object

      An optional user-provided state that contains information about the request.

    Remarks

    This method is used when the activity has a transaction that it requires the runtime to use. The workflow cannot persist between a call to RequireTransactionContext and the subsequent callback. Calling RequireTransactionContext again before the first call completes is not allowed and all calls after the first call result in exceptions. This method allows transactions flowed in from the host to be provided to the runtime without risking an intermediate persistence point. The state object that can be serialized is not necessary because the instance is guaranteed not to persist when this method is used.
